description: A rich and creamy tomato-based curry with soft paneer cubes, delicately spiced for a mild heat.
A fragrant and flavorful rice dish with tender chicken pieces, infused with aromatic spices and saffron. Spicy.
Sweet and soft milk-based balls soaked in a fragrant sugar syrup, perfect for a delightful end to your meal.
A crispy rice pancake filled with spiced potato mixture, served with coconut chutney and sambar. Mildly spicy.
A flavorful and spicy lamb curry, slow-cooked with aromatic spices and yogurt.
A classic combination of potatoes and cauliflower, cooked with spices and herbs. Mildly spicy.
Golden fried pastry filled with a savory mixture of spiced potatoes and peas. Mildly spicy.
Tender chicken pieces in a creamy tomato-based sauce, with a perfect balance of spices. Mildly spicy.
Spiced chickpea curry served with deep-fried puffed bread. A hearty and satisfying meal. Mildly spicy.
A refreshing yogurt-based drink, available in sweet or salted flavors.
A delightful combination of vinegared rice and fresh raw fish, paired with crisp vegetables. Can be spicy.
A traditional Japanese soup with tofu, seaweed, and a savory miso paste broth.
Lightly battered and deep-fried seafood and vegetables, served with a dipping sauce.
Sweet glutinous rice cakes filled with a variety of fillings, including red bean paste.
A hearty noodle soup with a rich broth, slices of meat, and fresh vegetables. Can be spicy.
A savory pancake with various ingredients, such as seafood, meat, and vegetables, drizzled with special sauces.
Grilled chicken glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, served with steamed rice.
Boiled young soybeans in the pod, lightly salted. A healthy and delicious appetizer.
A creamy dessert made with the subtle, earthy flavor of matcha green tea.
Exquisite thinly sliced raw fish or seafood, served without rice for a pure taste experience.
Aromatic basmati rice cooked with spices and tender pieces of meat. Served with raita. Spicy.
A nutritious and flavorful spinach-based curry with soft paneer cubes. Mildly spicy.
Crispy, deep-fried spirals of batter soaked in a fragrant sugar syrup. A sweet delight.
Ball-shaped snack filled with diced octopus, topped with savory sauces and bonito flakes.

Japanese noodle soup dish with Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat or fish-based broth, often flavored with soy sauce or miso, and uses toppings such as sliced pork, nori, menma, and scallions.
Battered and deep-fried seafood and vegetables, served with a dipping sauce. Crispy and delicious.
Traditional Japanese soup consisting of a dashi stock into which softened miso paste is mixed, along with tofu, seaweed, and green onions.
Rice balls typically filled with umeboshi (pickled plum), salmon, or other salty or sour ingredients, wrapped in nori.
Savory pancake containing a variety of ingredients like cabbage, meat, and seafood, topped with okonomiyaki sauce, mayonnaise, and bonito flakes.
Japanese curry served with a breaded, deep-fried pork cutlet on top of rice.
Grilled chicken skewers, often seasoned with tare sauce or salt.
Ball-shaped Japanese snack made of a wheat flour-based batter and cooked in a special molded pan, typically filled with minced or diced octopus, tempura scraps, pickled ginger, and green onion.
Breaded and deep-fried pork cutlet, usually served with shredded cabbage and a thick tonkatsu sauce.
Creamy and rich ice cream flavored with matcha green tea powder.
Slow-cooked stew of meat, typically beef or lamb, along with spices. Traditionally eaten as a breakfast dish.
Cottage cheese cubes cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based gravy, mildly spiced and buttery.
Red kidney beans cooked in a thick tomato-based gravy with spices. A popular North Indian dish.
Chicken marinated in yogurt and spices, cooked in a tandoor (clay oven), resulting in a smoky flavor and tender meat.
A popular street food from Mumbai, consisting of a spicy potato fritter (vada) sandwiched in a bread roll (pav).
Aromatic rice dish cooked with spices, herbs, and marinated meat or vegetables. Often garnished with fried onions and boiled eggs.
Cottage cheese cubes cooked in a smooth and creamy spinach gravy, flavored with spices.
Soft and spongy cottage cheese balls soaked in a creamy, sweetened milk flavored with cardamom and saffron.
Marinated cubes of cottage cheese grilled or baked until slightly charred. Served with mint chutney.
Yellow lentils cooked with spices and tempered with ghee, garlic, and red chilies. A comforting and hearty dish.
A spicy curry made from sprouted moth beans, served with pav (bread rolls). Garnished with onions, lemon, and farsan.
Comfort food made from rice and lentils, cooked with spices and ghee. Easy to digest and nutritious.
Breaded and deep-fried chicken cutlet, often served with tonkatsu sauce and shredded cabbage.
Chewy rice cake made from glutinous rice pounded into a paste and molded into shape. Often filled with sweet red bean paste.
Grilled chicken skewers seasoned with tare sauce or salt. A popular street food and bar snack.
Noodle soup in a miso-based broth, topped with vegetables, pork, and sometimes corn and butter.
Thin noodles made from buckwheat flour, served either chilled with a dipping sauce or in hot broth as a noodle soup.
Beef and onion simmered in a mildly sweet sauce of dashi, soy sauce, and mirin, served over rice.
Japanese style fried chicken, marinated in soy sauce, ginger, and garlic, then coated in flour and deep-fried.
Rolled omelette seasoned with soy sauce and sugar, often served as a side dish or sushi topping.
Chicken and egg simmered together in a savory-sweet sauce, served over a bowl of rice.
Udon noodles in a thick curry-flavored soup, often served with chunks of meat and vegetables.
Japanese dumplings filled with ground meat and vegetables, typically served with a dipping sauce.
Aromatic rice dish cooked with saffron, nuts, and dried fruits. A flavorful and fragrant dish from Kashmir.
Fish cooked in a spicy curry sauce.
A spicy vegetable mash served with buttered bread rolls. A popular street food from Mumbai.
A side dish made with yogurt, cucumbers, and spices. Often served with biryani or pulao.
Rice pudding made with milk, sugar, and flavored with cardamom and saffron. Garnished with nuts.
A rich and creamy dessert made with vermicelli, milk, dates, and nuts. A traditional Eid dish.
A savory snack made of puffed rice, vegetables, and a tangy tamarind sauce. A popular street food.
Crispy hollow puris filled with spicy tangy water, tamarind chutney, and a mixture of chickpeas and potatoes.
Scrambled paneer cooked with onions, tomatoes, and spices. A quick and easy dish.
